intro: Nonatelia nitida, commonly known as the smoothleaf nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, smooth leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Nonatelia nitida is often found in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
